subject: AI & Agents
title: The Dartmouth Conference: AI Gets Its Name
description: Learn The Dartmouth Conference: AI Gets Its Name in one minute.

hook.text: In the summer of 1956, ten scientists gathered at Dartmouth College to create a new field.

buildup.text: John McCarthy coined the term 'artificial intelligence' for the workshop proposal.

discovery.text: Attendees believed that every aspect of learning could, in principle, be precisely described for a machine.

twist.text: They predicted human-level AI within a generation. Seven decades later, we're still working on it.

climax.text: But the conference launched research programs at MIT, Stanford, and Carnegie Mellon that shaped the field.

punchline.text: AI was born optimistic and overconfident.
